title: How to Make Tropical Popsicles

steps.headline: Put the fruit pieces into popsicle molds.
steps.description: Do not overfill them, just add enough to fill to about half of the way.

steps.headline: Pour the coconut water into the mold to fill the mold.
steps.description: Insert the stick end of the mold.

steps.headline: Place in the freezer.
steps.description: Allow to freeze at least overnight. The popsicles can remain in the freezer for up to three months.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Simply remove the frozen popsicle from the mold and eat.

steps.headline: Puree the mango chunks with the pineapple juice in a food processor or blender.
steps.description: Puree until smooth. Tip the mango puree into a bowl and set aside.

steps.headline: Make the coconut puree.
steps.description: Add the coconut milk, sugar, yogurt into a bowl and stir together.

steps.headline: Pour 2 tablespoons of the mango puree into each popsicle mold.
steps.description: Put into the freezer to harden for 15 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove from the freezer and add 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) of coconut puree.
steps.description: Return to the freezer and let freeze for 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove and add another tablespoon of mango puree.
steps.description: This time insert a popsicle stick into the popsicle. Place in the freezer for another 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove from the freezer.
steps.description: Pour coconut puree in to the top of the mold. Return to the freezer and let freeze overnight or until fully set.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Whenever you want a popsicle, simply remove from the freezer and enjoy.

steps.headline: Place the coconut milk, passion-fruit juice, lime zest and powdered/icing sugar into the blender or food processor.
steps.description: Blend until well combined.

steps.headline: Add the passion-fruit pulp and simply stir through.
steps.description: You do not want to blend these, as the passion-fruit seeds should remain whole.

steps.headline: Pour the puree into popsicle molds.
steps.description: Add the mold sticks or popsicle sticks.

steps.headline: Place in the freezer.
steps.description: Freeze overnight or until firm.

steps.headline: Serve as required.
Place the coconut milk, pineapple pieces, mango pieces and banana in a blender or food processor.
steps.description: Blend or process until combined.

steps.headline: Taste.
steps.description: Add sugar to sweeten as desired, if at all.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture into the popsicle molds.
steps.description: Insert the popsicle sticks.

steps.headline: Place in the freezer.
steps.description: Freeze overnight or until set.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Remove from the freezer and eat.

text: Fresh fruit and coconut popsicles Put the fruit pieces into popsicle molds. Do not overfill them, just add enough to fill to about half of the way. Pour the coconut water into the mold to fill the mold. Insert the stick end of the mold. Place in the freezer. Allow to freeze at least overnight. The popsicles can remain in the freezer for up to three months. Serve. Simply remove the frozen popsicle from the mold and eat. Coconut and mango popsicles Puree the mango chunks with the pineapple juice in a food processor or blender. Puree until smooth. Tip the mango puree into a bowl and set aside. Make the coconut puree. Add the coconut milk, sugar, yogurt into a bowl and stir together. Pour 2 tablespoons of the mango puree into each popsicle mold. Put into the freezer to harden for 15 minutes. Remove from the freezer and add 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) of coconut puree. Return to the freezer and let freeze for 10 minutes. Remove and add another tablespoon of mango puree. This time insert a popsicle stick into the popsicle. Place in the freezer for another 10 minutes. Remove from the freezer. Pour coconut puree in to the top of the mold. Return to the freezer and let freeze overnight or until fully set. Serve. Whenever you want a popsicle, simply remove from the freezer and enjoy. Passion-fruit and coconut popsicles Place the coconut milk, passion-fruit juice, lime zest and powdered/icing sugar into the blender or food processor. Blend until well combined. Add the passion-fruit pulp and simply stir through. You do not want to blend these, as the passion-fruit seeds should remain whole. Pour the puree into popsicle molds. Add the mold sticks or popsicle sticks. Place in the freezer. Freeze overnight or until firm. Serve as required.  Banana tropical popsicles Place the coconut milk, pineapple pieces, mango pieces and banana in a blender or food processor. Blend or process until combined. Taste. Add sugar to sweeten as desired, if at all. Pour the mixture into the popsicle molds. Insert the popsicle sticks. Place in the freezer. Freeze overnight or until set. Serve. Remove from the freezer and eat.
